abstracts.cdata!:
The Lagos Metropolitan Development
            Project in Nigeria is a major investment in basic
            infrastructure towards improving the quality of life of
            Lagos State inhabitants, in particular, people living in
            slums. This will entail civil works, as well as
            rehabilitation works in slum areas, in water supply and
            sanitation, roads, drainage, power and other critical, basic
            infrastructure. The project will thus require displacement
            and relocation of people, currently residing around the
            proposed roads, or on other land intended for public
            infrastructure works. This Resettlement Policy Framework
            provides details on the populations affected, the regulation
            framework, the methods used to identify project affected
            persons (PAPs), the methods and scope of consultation with
            PAPs on resettlement issues, the resettlement and
            compensation packages, the institutional arrangements for
            implementing the RAP, its cost, special assistance to
            vulnerable PAPs, and external and internal monitoring.
            Eligibility for resettlement and compensation is based upon
            the country's legislation on resettlement, and the
            Bank's operational directive on involuntary
            resettlement. Any household identified as owning structures
            affected by the project is eligible for resettlement and
            compensation packages. Vulnerable groups will be compensated
            for any disturbance due to relocation. Social links will not
            be hindered by the relocation, and people will remain as
            close to employment opportunities as possible. Land for land
            compensation will be available for housing, and for
            commercial relocation as well.
